pkgmetadata.longdescription: Empirical Bayesian Tobit Matrix Estimation // Estimation tools for multidimensional Gaussian means using empirical Bayesian g-modeling. Methods are able to handle fully observed data as well as left-, right-, and interval-censored observations (Tobit likelihood); descriptions of these methods can be found in Barbehenn and Zhao (2023) arXiv:2306.07239. Additional, lower-level functionality based on Kiefer and Wolfowitz (1956) doi:10.1214/aoms/1177728066 and Jiang and Zhang (2009) doi:10.1214/08-AOS638 is provided that can be used to accelerate many empirical Bayes and nonparametric maximum likelihood problems.
